p: Compound 2 is a known solubilizer that can enhance skin and mucosal permeation of active ingredients in cosmetics and drug formulations [ 33]. However, its inertness as an excipient is an ongoing debate because it was reported to cause neurolepsis in mice (minimum symptomatic dose = 50 g/kg, intraperitoneal) and various CNS effects in rats (continuous inhalation at 0.27 and 4.5 ppm for 4 months) [ 33, 34]. Results in this study further confirm that inhalation exposure of compound 2 at 0.01 g/L for an hour can cause sedation in mice.
